text: Today on the West Coast, it’s a bit rough with 8 ft @8s NW swell and fresh 31 mph NNW winds making it blown out—best to give it a miss. Tomorrow sees a drop to 3 ft @9s WNW with lighter 16 mph SW winds; some sheltered spots like Ardnave Bay and Saligo Bay could be workable. Day after, conditions improve further with 4 ft @10s WNW and lighter 10 mph WNW winds, making it a good day for a surf. Best: day after.
